title: CASF Expands Signal Reach
summary: We are thrilled to announce that our new transmitter is live, bringing community radio to the wider Valley area.
body: After months of planning and generous community support, CASF 105.7 FM has officially powered up our new transmitter. This upgrade significantly improves reception in the outer valley regions, ensuring that more listeners can tune in to their favorite local programming. Station Manager Dave Fineberg expressed his gratitude to all the donors who made this possible. 'This is a huge milestone for independent media in our region,' he said.

title: Valley Harvest Community Market Returns
summary: Join us this Saturday for the grand reopening of the seasonal market.
body: The Valley Harvest Community Market is back for the season! Starting this Saturday at 8 AM, over 40 local vendors will be setting up shop at the fairgrounds. Expect fresh produce, artisan crafts, and live music hosted by CASF's very own 'Morning Coffee' team. We will be broadcasting live on location from 9 AM to noon.

title: New Show Alert: 'Valley Voices'
summary: A new weekly program dedicated to local history and storytelling.
body: We are excited to welcome Sarah J. to the CASF lineup with her new show, 'Valley Voices'. Airing every Tuesday at 7 PM, the program explores the rich history of our region through interviews with long-time residents and local historians. If you have a story to share, reach out to us via our Request page!

title: Town Council Update: Winter Parking
summary: Important information regarding overnight parking bans starting December 1st.
body: The Town Council has issued a reminder that the annual winter parking ban will go into effect on December 1st. To allow for safe snow removal, no on-street parking will be permitted between 1 AM and 6 AM. CASF will provide daily updates on snow clearing operations during our morning news segment.
